question.questionText: How does the water flow in a creek during a flood compared to normal water flow?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: During a flood there is more water in the creek and the water flows faster.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: A flooded stream would run faster and the height of the river would be higher.
The water flows a lot faster.
The water flow would change because if it floods it would overflow start a new and wider channel.
The water flows slow in a creek during a flood compared to a normal water flow.
